<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 117, 875, 154]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 165, 181, 183]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 163, 875, 200]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 210, 875, 293]]<|/det|>
The student places two pins \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) on the line \(\mathbf{FE}\), placing one pin close to \(\mathbf{E}\). She observes the images of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) through side \(\mathbf{CD}\) of the block so that the images of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) appear one behind the other. She places two pins \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{4}\) between her eye and the block so that \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{4}\), and the images of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) seen through the block, appear one behind the other.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 304, 183, 322]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 97, 91]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 91]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 808, 107]]<|/det|> The IGCSE class has a range of apparatus available. Here is a list of some apparatus. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 120, 272, 137]]<|/det|> ammeter <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 152, 284, 168]]<|/det|> barometer <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 183, 256, 200]]<|/det|> beaker <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 214, 348, 230]]<|/det|> electronic balance <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 244, 293, 260]]<|/det|> manometer <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 274, 354, 291]]<|/det|> measuring cylinder <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 305, 282, 322]]<|/det|> metre rule <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 336, 443, 353]]<|/det|> newtonmeter (spring balance) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 368, 282, 384]]<|/det|> stopwatch <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 399, 312, 415]]<|/det|> tape measure <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 429, 304, 446]]<|/det|> thermometer <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 460, 275, 477]]<|/det|> voltmeter <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 490, 875, 523]]<|/det|> Complete Table 5.1 by inserting the name of one piece of apparatus from the list that is the most suitable for measuring each quantity described. <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 536, 517, 554]]<|/det|> Table 5.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 567, 839, 772]]<|/det|>

volume of water
a distance of about 50 m
the force required to lift a laboratory stool

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 814, 109]]<|/det|>
The IGCSE class is carrying out a lens experiment. This involves using an illum object, a screen and a lens.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 117, 875, 153]]<|/det|>
Firstly, the distance between the illuminated object and the lens is measured with a metre rule. Next, a clearly focused image is obtained on the screen.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 165, 181, 184]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 163, 875, 200]]<|/det|>
Explain briefly how you would avoid a parallax (line-of-sight) error when using the metre rule.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 303, 178, 322]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 303, 848, 323]]<|/det|>
State a precaution that you would take to ensure that the image is well focused.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[799, 428, 876, 448]]<|/det|>
<mark>[Total: 7]
